text: In a agile platform rollout in fintech where a new analyst is struggling with stakeholder prep and deadlines are tight, what should the project manager do to allocate time to mentoring?

options.label: block recurring time for mentoring and keep it protected
postpone mentoring until after go-live
offer mentoring only when there is unexpected free time
assign mentoring to others without oversight

explanation: Option a is correct because dedicated time ensures mentoring actually happens. Option b is incorrect because waiting indefinitely means mentoring rarely occurs. Option c is incorrect because ad-hoc availability leads to inconsistency. Option d is incorrect because delegating without involvement reduces effectiveness.

text: Given a cross-functional platform rollout in healthcare where a junior PM is new to the company and several interns started recently, which action best helps allocate time to mentoring?

options.label: cancel mentoring sessions for minor conflicts
set mentoring goals with mentees and review progress
treat mentoring as optional afterthought
postpone mentoring until after go-live

explanation: Option b is correct because goals make the time purposeful and effective. Option a is incorrect because frequent cancellations signal low priority. Option c is incorrect because without priority, mentoring value is lost. Option d is incorrect because waiting indefinitely means mentoring rarely occurs.
